heading: Hydra Sorcerer Endgame Build Guide
content: Welcome to the Hydra Sorcerer Endgame Guide! Season 9 introduced a brand new -focused unique: . This item seems absolutely insane at a first glance, with a fully upgraded Ancestral weapon, your can have up to 18 heads so this item turns that into a 15x damage multiplier! However, your also now have 6 times less heads and, compared to a Legendary Amulet, you are missing an offensive aspect and potentially 3-4 ranks to a good passive. With all of the above taken into account this item only buffs the damage output of your by about 50% but it also does one more thing. It makes your shoot explosive projectiles that deal AoE damage! is another major source of damage for the build which also determines your playstyle. You need to stack a lot of Mana and then cast a single , consuming it all. Then you kinda just run around supporting that and regenerating your Mana until you're ready to cast the next one. To go fast with Hydra Sorcerer there's two things you need to do: In order to meet the first objective we need to get the cooldown of our Evade low enough to reset it with a single cast of . With perfect gear you can do it simply by masterworking Evade Cooldown Reduction on your Boots and keep your Staff. If you're missing a bit of CDR you have to go Wand + Focus with CDR (and ). The latter setup is also slightly better because of faster cast animations but if you can reach the CDR breakpoint without it, it's generally not worth bothering. In order to spam we need to generate a ton of Mana. To that end we use: Combined with all other sources of Mana Regen we already have in the build such as , this should boost your Mana Regen to over 500 per second! Since we don't have time to cast on anything that isn't a boss, we replace if with . This gives us Attack Speed, stacks, some Vulnerable application and it also lets us maintain permanent Crackling Energy (with some help from tempers on Boots and Gloves). On our paragon boards we replace the last 2 boards with to have more upfront unconditional damage: Finally, for runes we use for consistent damage bonuses and more Teleport ranks. If your CDR is not high enough for perma dips below 10 stacks, replace This setup optimizes the build to push the highest possible Tiers in after you have finished the variant and reached a plateau in your progression. In order to maximize the damage output of the build we use . This item gives a lot of Intelligence and double damage. Since this build has a lot of downtime between casts, it's easy to shoot here and there in order to keep up the buff. We have to lose but in high tier pits the Enchantment alone is more than enough. The build works really well when you decimate everything in seconds, but may get overwhelmed if fights are long against high level monsters. There are several adjustments you can make when you have trouble with more difficult content: does not get extra heads from Weapon Temper or from implicit stats. It always spawns with 5 Heads, or rather 3 Heads and +200% extra damage. This alone makes it 5 times weaker than your regular Hydras. On top of that it has a conflict with because it spawns after you already spend all your Mana and doesn't get any bonus damage. This build has a lot of Crit Chance bonuses that don't display in your Stat Sheet: Together, these add up to +90% Crit Chance which instantly lets you reach the cap of 100% without any rolls on gear. The only exception to that is high tier Pit Pushing where is often inactive. There you want to have around 140% effective Crit Chance. Luckily a with a Greater Affix on Crit can take care of that singlehandedly. Each Hydra head will attack the closest enemy at a constant rate that scales with the player's Attack Speed. Hydra attacks immediately upon spawn but casting Hydra repeatedly doesn't make them attack faster than they normally would. Sorcerer offers a slow and relaxed way to play Sorcerer. While a fully optimized playstyle can be as involved as any other build, you can get 70-80% of its efficiency simply by pressing 1 button every 5 seconds. If typical for a Sorcerer high-octane 400 APM gameplay is not for you, give Hydra a shot!
